oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bispectral index and hemodynamic effects of a constant rate infusion of propofol combined with fentanyl in calves under spontaneous ventilation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Deschk, M.
Trein, T. A.
Wagatsuma, J. T.
Silva, G. L.
Rodrigues, C. A.
Santos, P. S. P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: intravenous anesthesia
anesthesia
analgesia
bispectral index
BIS
propofol
fentanyl
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Total intravenous anesthesia is an anesthetic modality which is commonly used in cattle due to its practicality, as it eliminates the need for sophisticated equipment and can be used under field conditions, providing adequate anesthesia and analgesia for bovine patients. This study evaluated the bispectral index (BIS) and hemodynamic effects of a constant rate infusion of propofol combined with fentanyl in calves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2014; 162-163
